name: Mary Kenneth Keller
known-for: First Female Ph.D. in Computer Science

anecdotes.title: Sister Mary Kenneth Keller
anecdotes.body: Sister Mary was born in Ohio in 1914. She entered the Sisters of Charity in 1932 and professed her vows in 1940.

anecdotes.title: Education
anecdotes.body: She went to DePaul University, where she received a B.S. in Mathematics and an M.S. in Mathematics and Physics. In 1965, she received her Ph.D. in Computer Science from The University of Wisconsin.

anecdotes.title: Thesis
anecdotes.body: Her thesis, 'Inductive Inference on Computer Generated Patterns.', was written in CDC FORTRAN 63. In 1965, she became the first American female to obtain a Ph.D. in Computer Science.

anecdotes.title: Clarke College Computer Science
anecdotes.body: She founded the computer science department at Clarke College in Iowa, which she directed for 20 years. She was passionate about providing access and information to everyone , not just computer scientists, to encourage independent thinking.
